12   |  ** 									     **
13   |  **   Description:	Lists the currently loaded modulefiles.		     **
14   |  ** 									     **
15   |  **   Exports:		ModuleCmd_List					     **
16   |  ** 									     **
17   |  **   Notes:								     **

60   | static	char	module_name[] = __FILE__;
61   | #if WITH_DEBUGGING_MODULECMD
62   | static	char	_proc_ModuleCmd_List[] = "ModuleCmd_List";
63   | #endif
64   | 
65   | /** ************************************************************************ **/
66   | /**				    PROTOTYPES				     **/
67   | /** ************************************************************************ **/
68   | 
69   | /** not applicable **/
70   | 
71   | 
72   | /*++++
73   |  ** ** Function-Header ***************************************************** **
74   |  ** 									     **
75   |  **   Function:		ModuleCmd_List					     **
76   |  ** 									     **
77   |  **   Description:	Execution of the module-command 'list'		     **
78   |  **			Lists all modules stored in the environment variable **
79   |  **			'LOADEDMODULES'					     **
80   |  ** 									     **
81   |  **   First Edition:	1991/10/23					     **
82   |  ** 									     **
83   |  **   Parameters:	Tcl_Interp	*interp		Attached Tcl Interp. **
84   |  **			int		 argc		Number of args	     **
85   |  **			char 		*argv[]		Argument list	     **
86   |  ** 									     **
87   |  **   Result:		int	TCL_ERROR	Failure			     **
88   |  **				TCL_OK		Successful operation	     **
89   |  ** 									     **
90   |  **   Attached Globals:							     **
91   |  ** 									     **
92   |  ** ************************************************************************ **
93   |  ++++*/
94   | 
95   | int	ModuleCmd_List(	Tcl_Interp	*interp,
96   | 			int		 argc,
97   |                    	char		*argv[])
98   | {
99   |     /**
100  |      **  Get the list of loaded modules at first
101  |      **/
102  | 
103  |     char	*loaded, *lmfiles;
104  |     int		 i, count1, count2;
105  |     char	*list[ MOD_BUFSIZE];
106  |     char	*files[ MOD_BUFSIZE];
107  |     char	*tmplist[ MOD_BUFSIZE], *s;
108  |     int	  	 len;
109  | 
110  | #if WITH_DEBUGGING_MODULECMD
111  |     ErrorLogger( NO_ERR_START, LOC, _proc_ModuleCmd_List, NULL);
112  | #endif
113  | 
114  |     lmfiles = getLMFILES( interp);
115  |     loaded = getenv( "LOADEDMODULES");
116  |     
117  |     if( !loaded || !*loaded) {
118  | 	if( sw_format & (SW_TERSE | SW_LONG | SW_HUMAN) )
119  | 	    fprintf(stderr, "%s\n",
120  | 		_("No Modulefiles Currently Loaded."));
121  |     } else {
122  | 
123  | 	/**
124  | 	 **  Now tokenize it, form a list and print it out.
125  | 	 **/
126  | 
127  | 	if( sw_format & SW_LONG ) {
128  | 	    fprintf( stderr, _(long_header));
129  | 	}
130  | 	if( sw_format & (SW_TERSE | SW_LONG | SW_HUMAN) )
131  | 	    fprintf( stderr, "%s\n",
132  | 		_("Currently Loaded Modulefiles:"));
133  | 
134  | 	/**
135  | 	 **  LOADEDMODULES and _LMFILES_ should provide a list of loaded
136  | 	 **  modules and assigned files in the SAME ORDER
137  | 	 ** but double check, because if they aren't you will get a crash.
138  | 	 **/
139  | 
140  | 	count1 = 1;
141  |         for( list[ 0] = xstrtok( loaded, ":");
142  | 	    (list[ count1] = xstrtok( NULL, ":"));
143  | 	     count1++ );
144  | 
145  | 	count2 = 1;
146  |         for( files[ 0] = xstrtok( lmfiles, ":");
147  | 	    (files[ count2] = xstrtok( NULL, ":"));
148  | 	     count2++ );
149  | 	if (count1 != count2) {
150  | 	  ErrorLogger( ERR_ENVVAR, LOC, NULL);
151  | 	}
152  | 	  
153  | 
154  | 	/**
155  | 	 **  We have to build a single list of files for each loaded entry
156  | 	 **  in order to be able to figure out the length of the directory
157  | 	 **  part
158  | 	 **/
159  | 
160  | 	for( i=0; i<count1; i++) {
161  | 
162  | 	    len = strlen( files[i]) - strlen( list[i]);
163  | 	    tmplist[i] = files[i];
164  | 
165  | 	    /**
166  | 	     **  We have to source all relevant .modulerc and .version files
167  | 	     **  on the path
168  | 	     **/
169  | 
170  | 	    s = files[i] + len;
171  | 	    while( s) {
172  | 		if( (s = strchr( s, '/')) )
173  | 		    *s = '\0';
174  | 
175  | 		SourceRC( interp, files[i], modulerc_file);
176  | 		SourceVers( interp, files[i], list[i]);
177  | 
178  | 		if( s)
179  | 		    *s++ = '/';
180  | 	    }
181  | 
182  | 	    /** 
183  | 	     **  Print this guy
184  | 	     **/
185  | 	}
186  | 	print_aligned_files( interp, NULL, NULL, tmplist, count1, 1);
187  |     }
188  | 
189  |     /**
190  |      **  Return on success
191  |      **/
192  | 
193  | #if WITH_DEBUGGING_MODULECMD
194  |     ErrorLogger( NO_ERR_END, LOC, _proc_ModuleCmd_List, NULL);
195  | #endif
196  | 
197  |     return( TCL_OK);
198  | 
199  | } /** End of 'ModuleCmd_List' **/
